ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They will say, 'Can we be granted a reprieve?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Then will they say: "Can we be given respite?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: they say: "Can we be granted some respite?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They will say, "Can we be granted any respite?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They will therefore say, “Will we get some respite?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then they will say: "Can we be respited"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then they will say: Shall we be respited?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and they will say, 'Shall we be respited?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Then they will say: Are we to be reprieved?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Then they will exclaim, "Could we have some respite?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then they will say: are we to be respited?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Thereupon they will say, ‘Shall we be granted any respite?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then they will say: "Shall we be respited?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then they will say: "Can we be respited?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and then they will say: 'Shall we be respited'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Then they will say, “Are we given any respite?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And they will say, "May we be reprieved?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:203] Thereupon they will say, ‘Shall we be granted any respite?’, that we might become believers?; and it shall be said to them, ‘No!’, and they will say, ‘When will this chastisement be?’ God, exalted be He, says:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Then they will say) when the punishment comes upon them: (Are we to be reprieved) from the punishment?
